item.title: Using MLFlow to version your ML models [Part 1]
item.description: Preamble If you’ve doing anything with machine-learning in the past, you know how much of a pain it is to keep track of your models. When testing, you might have multiple versions of the same model just lying around, without knowing what parameters went into it to produce the result. MLFlow aims to tackle this issue. Setting up MLFlow Before installing MLFlow, it is recommended to initialize a virtual environment first:

item.title: About
item.description: Who am I? My name is Mitchell. I’m a junior software engineer from the Netherlands with an interest in systems-programming, writing tools and scripts, and Artificial Intelligence. In my short career I’ve accumulated experience with a lot of programming languages. Most notably I use Rust, Go, C# and Python almost daily. These 4 are by far my favourite languages. I’ve also racked up some experience with C, C++, Java, Haskell, Bash, web-languages like PHP (& Laravel) & Java/Typescript.
